---
title: Overview
---

Open Game Backend is built from the ground up to enable as many game developers as possible to write backend code & modify existing modules.

![Structure](/images/structure.svg)

## Components

Modules have access to the following core components:

- [**Scripts**](/build/scripts) Scripts are used to write TypeScript & [Deno](https://deno.com/) code that runs on the backend. Request & response types are automatically validated.
- [**Database**](/build/database) Modules can write database schemas, query data from scripts with type safety, and automatically create + migrate databases.
- [**User Config**](/build/user-config) Modules can allow projects to pass configuration options to the module.
- [**Errors**](/build/errors) Modules specify the types of errors that can occur in their scripts.

## File structure

**Required**

- `module.json` Module configuration file. [Documentation](/build/module-config)
- `scripts/`
    - `*.ts` Script to run on the backend. [Documentation](/build/scripts)
- `db/` _(optional)_ Database-related files. [Documentation](/build/database)
    - `schema.prisma` Database schema.
    - `migrations/` Database migrations auto-generated from `schema.prisma`. This directory should not be manually modified unless you know what you are doing.
- `config.ts` _(optional)_ Defines user-provided config schema. [Documentation](/build/user-config)
- `public.ts` _(optional)_ Exports shared functions & types across modules. [Documentation](/build/public)
